data.title: TransDigm Group Non-GAAP EPS of $7.83 beats by $0.09, revenue of $2B misses by $30M
data.description:
• TransDigm Group press release (NYSE:TDG): Q1 Non-GAAP EPS of $7.83 beats by $0.09.
  • Revenue of $2B (+11.7% Y/Y) misses by $30M.

  • TransDigm expects fiscal 2025 financial guidance to be as follows:

    • Net sales are anticipated to be in the range of $8,750 million to $8,950 million vs $8.90B consensus compared with $7,940 million in fiscal 2024, an increase of 11.5% at the midpoint;
    • Net income is anticipated to be in the range of $1,925 million to $2,037 million compared with $1,715 million in fiscal 2024, an increase of 15.5% at the midpoint;
    • Earnings per share is expected to be in the range of $32.27 to $34.19 per share based upon weighted average shares outstanding of 58.15 million shares, compared with $25.62 per share in fiscal 2024, which is an increase of 29.7% at the midpoint;
    • EBITDA As Defined is anticipated to be in the range of $4,615 million to $4,755 million compared with $4,173 million in fiscal 2024, an increase of 12.3% at the midpoint (corresponding to an EBITDA As Defined margin guide of approximately 52.9% for fiscal 2025);
    • Adjusted earnings per share is expected to be in the range of $35.51 to $37.43 per share vs $37.44 consensus compared with $33.99 per share in fiscal 2024, an increase of 7.3% at the midpoint; and

data.title: Merck in Charts: KEYTRUDA continues growth trajectory with 18.6% rise in Q4
PayPal Q4 earnings top consensus, but expenses also climb
data.description:
PayPal Holdings (NASDAQ:PYPL) posted stronger-than-expected earnings and revenue and issued strong guidance, but its stock slumped 7.1% in Tuesday premarket trading as expenses exceeded the consensus estimate. Transaction margin dollar growth also slowed from the previous quarter.

The company expects Q1 non-GAAP EPS of $1.15-$1.17 vs. average analyst estimate of $1.13.

Full year non-GAAP EPS guidance of $4.95-$5.10 compares with the consensus estimate of $4.90.

Q4 non-GAAP EPS of $1.19, beating the $1.12 consensus, slipped from $1.20 in Q3 and increased from $1.14 in Q4 2023.

Q4 revenue of $8.37B, topping the average analyst estimate of $8.28B, climbed from $7.85B in the prior quarter and $8.03B a year ago.

"PayPal had a strong finish to a successful 2024 with results that were better than we expected," said President and CEO Alex Chriss. "The improvements we made to branded checkout, peer-to-peer, and Venmo, plus the progress we made on our price-to-value strategy, are beginning to show up in our results."

Total active accounts, at 434M at Dec. 31, 2024, rose from 432M at Sept. 30 and exceeded the Visible Alpha estimate of 433M.

Q4 total payment volume ("TPV") of $437.8B, topping the Visible Alpha consensus of $437.3B, rose from $422.6B in the prior quarter and $409.8B a year ago.

PayPal's (NASDAQ:PYPL) transaction margin dollars increased 7% Y/Y to $3.94B, compared with Q3 growth of 8% Y/Y.

Total operating expenses of $6.93B, exceeding the Visible Alpha estimate of $6.51B, rose from $6.46B in Q3 and $6.30B in Q4 2023.

Net cash provided by operating activities was $2.39B, up from $1.61B in the previous quarter and down from $2.61B a year ago; adjusted free cash flow of $2.10B compared with $1.54B in Q3 and $774M in Q4 2023.

Conference call at 8:00 AM ET.

Earlier, PayPal Non-GAAP EPS of $1.19 beats by $0.07, revenue of $8.4B beats by $120M

data.title: Earnings Snapshot: Pfizer tops Q4, but FY2025 outlook falls short of expectations
Snow Lake surges on partnership to 'lead North American nuclear renaissance'
data.description:
Snow Lake Resources (NASDAQ:LITM) +15.3% pre-market Monday after announcing a strategic partnership through a memorandum of understanding with Exodys Energy to explore opportunities in the nuclear energy sector.

Exodys is an engineering firm focused on developing nuclear fuel recycling solutions to convert thousands of metrics tons of used nuclear fuel into feedstock to support clean energy; the company has led industrial consortia with suppliers and customers to advance groundbreaking nuclear research initiatives, obtaining more than $200M in strategic support.

Exodys also will lend its expertise to assess the development and deployment of current and advanced reactor technologies, Snow Lake (NASDAQ:LITM) said.

"Consistent with our strategy to develop a portfolio of clean energy materials, this strategic partnership with Exodys Energy enables us to pursue opportunities in the nuclear energy sector beyond our current focus on uranium exploration, and positions us as a key player in securing North America's energy independence," Snow Lake (LITM) CEO Frank Wheatley said.

data.title: J.M. Smucker unloads its Cloverhill and Big Texas brands as part of a portfolio optimization plan
data.description:
J.M. Smucker Co. (NYSE:SJM) is following through with its plans to narrow the focus of the business. The company divested its Cloverhill and Big Texas brands, as well as certain private label products, to JTM Foods.

The all-cash transaction is valued at approximately $40 million, subject to a working capital adjustment, and includes relevant trademarks and licenses and the company's manufacturing facility in Chicago, Illinois. The company anticipates using the net proceeds from the transaction to pay down debt. The transaction is anticipated to close in SJM's fiscal fourth quarter.

The divested value brands and private label products generated net sales of approximately $30 million for J.M. Smucker's (NYSE:SJM) fiscal year that ended April 30, 2024, which represents a partial year of net sales reported in its Sweet Baked Snacks segment results following the acquisition on November 7, 2023. For fiscal year 2025, the Company anticipates full-year net sales from the divested value brands and private label products to be approximately $60 million.

"This divestiture reflects our continued commitment to portfolio optimization to prioritize resources to support the execution of our Sweet Baked Snacks strategy, focused on growing the Hostess brand, and advancing our leadership in the sweet baked goods category," said Dan O'Leary, Senior Vice President and General Manager, Sweet Baked Snacks and Pet. "This decision continues the ongoing work to ensure our manufacturing network is optimized to mitigate costs and reduce complexity," added O'Leary.

The food company expects the divestiture to be immaterial to its adjusted earnings per share on a full-year basis.
